subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says:"Be renewed is the spirit of your mind, so that you may put on the new man which was created according to God, in true righteousness and holiness." (Eph. 4:23, 24)
reflection: When we decide to follow Christ we must put on a new nature, head in a new direction, and have a new way of thinking, that the Holy Spirit gives.
prayer: I thank You Lord for the day I decided to follow Christ, BUT I still need Your Spirit's help each and every day so, I pray that I will be sensitive and obedient to Your Spirit's leading each day. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Paul says:_"Be renewed is the spirit of your mind, so that _

_you may put on the new man which was created according _

_to God, in true righteousness __and holiness." _(Eph. 4:23, 24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we decide to follow Christ we must put on a new nature,

head in a new direction, and have a new way of thinking, that

the Holy Spirit gives.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for the day I decided to follow Christ,

BUT I still need Your Spirit's help each and every day so,

I pray that I will be sensitive and obedient to Your Spirit's

leading each day. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Be angry and do not sin," Do not let the sun go down on your wrath, nor give place to the devil. (Eph. 4:26, 27)
reflection: The Bible doesn't tell us we shouldn't feel anger, BUT IT points out that it is important to handle our anger properly. If we keep it inside, it can cause us to become bitter and destroy us from within. Paul says to deal with our anger immediately, in a way that builds relationships rather than destroying them. Don't let the day end before you begin to work on mending your relationship.
prayer: O Lord, please forgive me, I am often guilty of bottling up anger within. Help me to properly handle my anger toward those who have ruffled my feathers so to speak. Help me build a more compassionate spirit. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be angry and do not sin," Do not let the sun go_

_down on your wrath, nor give place to the devil._

(Eph. 4:26, 27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Bible doesn't tell us we shouldn't feel anger, BUT IT

points out that it is important to handle our anger properly.

If we keep it inside, it can cause us to become bitter and

destroy us from within. Paul says to deal with our anger

immediately, in a way that builds relationships rather than

destroying them. Don't let the day end before you begin to

work on mending your relationship.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord, please forgive me, I am often guilty of bottling up

anger within. Help me to properly handle my anger toward

those who have ruffled my feathers so to speak. Help me

build a more compassionate spirit. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth, but what is good for necessary edification. that it may impart grace to the hearer." (Eph. 4:29)
reflection: Paul warns against unwholesome language, bitterness, improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad attitudes toward others. Instead we should be forgiving just as God has forgiven us. . .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the words that I speak would always be edifying and pleasing to You. I pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let no corrupt word proceed out of your mouth,_

_but what is good for necessary edification. that it_

_may impart grace to the hearer." _(Eph. 4:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul warns against unwholesome language, bitterness,

improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad

attitudes toward others. Instead we should be forgiving

just as God has forgiven us. . .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the words that I

speak would always be edifying and pleasing to You.

I pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption." (Eph. 4:30)
reflection: The presence of the Holy Spirit within us demonstrates the genuineness of our faith, and proves that we are God's children, and secures eternal life for us. The Spirit's power works in us to transform us now, for that day of redemption.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the power of Your Spirit will continue His work in my life so that I may become a more faithful believer. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you _

_were sealed for the day of redemption." _(Eph. 4:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The presence of the Holy Spirit within us demonstrates

the genuineness of our faith, and proves that we are God's

children, and secures eternal life for us. The Spirit's power

works in us to transform us now, for that day of redemption.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that the power of Your Spirit

will continue His work in my life so that I may become a

more faithful believer. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil speaking be put away from you, with all malice." (Eph. 4:31)
reflection: The main thought for every believer is to rid ourselves of all evil practices and immorality. If we have made such a commitment to Christ, are we remaining true to it?
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that Your Spirit would help me remain true to my commitment, I pray this in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, clamor, and evil_

_speaking be put away from you, with all malice."_

(Eph. 4:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The main thought for every believer is to rid ourselves

of all evil practices and immorality. If we have made

such a commitment to Christ, are we remaining true to it?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Spirit would help me remain

true to my commitment, I pray this in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you." (Eph. 4:32)
reflection: As we come to understand God's mercy we will want to become like Him. Having received forgiveness we should be willing to pass it on to others. Those who are unwilling to forgive have NOT become one with Christ, who was willing to forgive even those who crucified Him (Luke 23:34).
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me for not always being as kind or forgiving as I should be to others. I thank You for being forgiving, because it was due to my sins You went to the cross and died. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one _

_another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you."_

(Eph. 4:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As we come to understand God's mercy we will want to

become like Him. Having received forgiveness we should

be willing to pass it on to others. Those who are unwilling

to forgive have NOT become one with Christ, who was willing

to forgive even those who crucified Him (Luke 23:34).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me for not always being as kind or

forgiving as I should be to others. I thank You for being

forgiving, because it was due to my sins You went to the

cross and died. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Follow God's example in everything you do, because you are God's dear children." (Eph. 5:1))
reflection: "Follow Gods example:" This raises a great question. How can we be perfect? Lets look at 4 areas in which we need to grow: (1) character (2) holiness (3) maturity (4) love Now we can be perfect, if our behavior is appropriate for our maturity level--yet with room to grow. Our tendency to sin MUST NEVER deter us from trying to become more like Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord I pray that I would be submissive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance so that I might grow in character, holiness, maturity, and love, helping me to become more like Christ. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Follow God's example in everything you do, because you are _

_God's dear children." _(Eph. 5:1))

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Follow Gods example:" _This raises a great question. How can

we be perfect? Lets look at 4 areas in which we need to grow:

_(1) character_ _ (2) holiness (3) maturity_ (4) _love _Now we can

_be perfect, if our behavior is appropriate for our maturity
level--yet _

with room to grow. Our tendency to sin MUST NEVER deter us from

trying to become more like Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I pray that I would be submissive to Your Holy Spirit's

guidance so that I might grow in character, holiness, maturity, and

love, helping me to become more like Christ. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Live a life filled with love for others, following the example of Christ who loved you and gave His life as a sacrifice to take away your sins." (Eph. 5:2)
reflection: We are to love others based on Jesus' sacrificial love for us. such love will not only bring unbelievers to Christ, it will also keep believers strong and united in a world hostile to God. Jesus was a living example of God's love, as we are to be an example of Jesus' love.
prayer: O Lord of love, grace, and mercy, I thank You for Your love which caused You to sacrifice Your one and only son, that I might have eternal life. I pray that my life would become an example of Your love. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Live a life filled with love for others, following the example of
Christ _

_who loved you and gave His life as a sacrifice to take away your
sins." _

(Eph. 5:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are to love others based on Jesus' sacrificial love for us. such
love

will not only bring unbelievers to Christ, it will also keep
believers

strong and united in a world hostile to God. Jesus was a living
example

of God's love, as we are to be an example of Jesus' love.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of love, grace, and mercy, I thank You for Your love which

caused You to sacrifice Your one and only son, that I might have

eternal life. I pray that my life would become an example of Your

love. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed be found among you. Such sins have no place among God's people." (Eph. 5:3)
reflection: We should consider ourselves dead to sexual immorality, impurity, or greed. We must make a conscious, decision each day to remove anything that supports or feeds these desires. To do this we must rely on the Holy Spirit's power.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, once again I have to plead with You for the guidance of Your Holy Spirit's power to help me to avoid the sins of immorality, impurity, and greed. I ask this in the name of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed be found _

_among you. Such sins have no place among God's people." _(Eph. 5:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We should consider ourselves dead to sexual immorality, impurity,

or greed. We must make a conscious, decision each day to remove

anything that supports or feeds these desires. To do this we must

rely on the Holy Spirit's power.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, once again I have to plead with You

for the guidance of Your Holy Spirit's power to help me to

avoid the sins of immorality, impurity, and greed. I ask this

in the name of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says"you can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and God. For a greedy person is really an idolater who worships the things of this world." (Eph. 5:5)
reflection: Christians come out of all kinds of different backgrounds including these just mentioned. They may struggle with evil desires, but they should not continue in these practices. In I Corinthians 6:11 Paul clearly states that even those who sin in these ways can have their lives changed by Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I point my finger at those who live in sin openly, for I know that in Your eyes I am a sinner only saved by Your grace. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Paul says _"you can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy_

_person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and God. For a greedy_

_person is really an idolater who worships the things of this world."
_

(Eph. 5:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christians come out of all kinds of different back-grounds including
these

just mentioned. They may struggle with evil desires, but they should
not

continue in these practices. In I Cor. 6:11 Paul clearly states that
even those

who sin in these ways can have their lives changed by Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I point my finger at those

who live in sin openly, for I know that in Your eyes I am a sinner

only saved by Your grace. . .Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins; (immorality, impurity, greed) for the terrible anger of God comes upon those who disobey." (Eph. 5:6)
reflection: God cannot tolerate sin because His nature is morally perfect. He cannot ignore or condone willful rebellion. God wants to remove the sin and restore the sinner, and He is able to, as long as the sinner does not stubbornly distort or reject the truth. Don't suppress the truth about Him merely to protect your own life style.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would never fall prey to the sins of immorality, impurity, or greed. But I know that I am a sinner saved only by Your Grace. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"_Don't be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins; _

(immorality, impurity, greed) _for the terrible anger of God comes_

_upon those who disobey." _(Eph. 5:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God cannot tolerate sin because His nature is morally perfect. He

cannot ignore or condone willful rebellion. God wants to remove

the sin and restore the sinner, and He is able to, as long as the
sinner

does not stubbornly distort or reject the truth. Don't suppress the
truth

about Him merely to protect your own life style.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would never fall prey to the

sins of immorality, impurity, or greed. But I know that I am a

sinner saved only by Your Grace. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Though your hearts were once full of darkness, now you are full of light from the Lord and your behavior should show it." (Eph. 5:8)
reflection: As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith. We should live beyond reproach morally so that we will reflect God's goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon on the Mount. (Matthew 5:15, 16)
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior would be pleasing to You. I pray that my behavior would always reflect my faith, and that it would always reflect Your goodness to others. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Though your hearts were once full of darkness, now you are _

_full of light from the Lord and your behavior should show it."_

(Eph. 5:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith.

We should live beyond reproach morally so that we will reflect

God's goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon

on the Mount. (Mt. 5:15, 16)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that my behavior would be pleasing to You.

I pray that my behavior would always reflect my faith, and that

it would always reflect Your goodness to others. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: " Take no part in worthless deeds OF evil AND darkness, instead, rebuke and expose them." (Eph. 5; 11)
reflection: It is important to AVOID worthless deeds of evil, but we are to go further, Paul says we are to EXPOSE THEM, because our silence may be interpreted as approval. God needs people who will take a stand.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be ready to be a witness for You, and that I would always be ready to defend Your name. I pray these things in Jesus name. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_" Take no part in worthless deeds OF evil AND darkness,_

_instead, rebuke and expose them." _(Eph. 5;11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is important to AVOID worthless deeds of evil, but we are

to go further, Paul says we are to EXPOSE THEM, because our

silence may be interpreted as approval. God needs people

who will take a stand.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be ready

to be a witness for You, and that I would always be ready

to defend Your name. I pray these things in Jesus name. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Be careful how you live, not as fools, but as those who are wise. Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days. (Eph. 5:15, 16)
reflection: You would almost think Paul had been listening to CNN. We surely are living in evil days. We need to be careful to keep our standards high, and do good wherever we can, BUT we also need to be wise and keep our focus on our Savior, who came to pay for the sins of the whole world.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, You know better then we that we do live in evil days. I thank You, for providing for us a Savior who willing paid the penalty for my sins. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be careful how you live, not as fools, but as those who are wise. _

_Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil _

_days. _(Eph. 5:15, 16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

You would almost think Paul had been listening to CNN.

We surely are living in evil days. We need to be careful to

keep our standards high, and do good wherever we can, BUT

we also need to be wise and keep our focus on our Savior,

who came to pay for the sins of the whole world.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, You know better then we that we do

live in evil days. I thank You, for providing for us a Savior

who willing paid the penalty for my sins. . .Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Don't act thoughtlessly, try to understand what the Lord wants you to do." (Eph. 5:17)
reflection: Being made holy is the process of living the Christian life. It is part of the Holy Spirit work in us conforming us to the image of Christ. (Romans 8:29)
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, forgive me for not always being in tune with Your Spirit's leading. I pray that I would become more sensitive to Your Spirit attempting to conform me into the image of Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Don't act thoughtlessly, try to understand what the _

_Lord wants you to do." _(Eph. 5:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Being made holy is the process of living the Christian life.

It is part of the Holy Spirit work in us conforming us to the

image of Christ. (Ro. 8:29)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, forgive me for not always being in

tune with Your Spirit's leading. I pray that I would become

more sensitive to Your Spirit attempting to conform me into

the image of Christ. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "SUBMIT TO ONE ANOTHER OUT OF REVERENCE TO CHRIST." (EPH. 5:21)
reflection: Submitting to another person is often a misunderstood concept. It does not mean becoming a door mat. Christ at whose Name"every knee will bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth" (Philippians 2:10). submitted His will to the Father, and we honor Christ, by following His example. When we submit to God, we become more willing to obey His command to submit to others.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would have a more submissive spirit, so that I would develop a more Christ-like image. I pray that I would become more sensitive to Your Spirit's leading, so that I would be open to Your every command. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"SUBMIT TO ONE ANOTHER OUT OF REVERENCE TO CHRIST."_

(EPH. 5:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Submitting to another person is often a misunderstood concept.

It does not mean becoming a door mat. Christ at whose Name

_"every knee will bow, in heaven and on earth and under the_

_earth_" (Phil. 2:10)...submitted His will to the Father, and we

honor Christ, by following His example. When we submit to

God, we become more willing to obey His command to submit

to others.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would have a more submissive

spirit, so that I would develop a more Christ-like image. I pray

that I would become more sensitive to Your Spirit's leading, so

that I would be open to Your every command. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Eph. 5:22-32) What is being said in these verses is:"Husband and wives should have a Spirit-guided relations." Paul sums up what is said in these verses in Vs. 33:"So again I say, each man must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband."
reflection: If you read all the verses, what you should surmise is that you should care for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate his or her needs, helping them to become all that they can be.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be in tune with Your Spirit's guidance so that my relationship with my wife and others would be one of love and respect. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSES FOR TODAY:

(Eph. 5:22-32) What is being said in these verses is:"Husband and

wives should have a Spirit-guided relations." Paul sums up what is

said in these verses in Vs. 33: _"So again I say, each man must love
_

_his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her
husband."_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you read all the verses, what you should surmise is that you
should

care for your spouse as you care for yourself, learning to anticipate
his

or her needs, helping them to become all that they can be.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be in tune with Your Spirit's

guidance so that my relationship with my wife and others would be

one of love and respect.. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Honor Your father and mother. This is the first of the commandments, that ends with a promise," (Eph. 6:2)
reflection: There is a difference between obeying and honoring. To obey, means to do what one is told; to honor means to respect and love. Children are to obey while under their parent's care, but the responsibility to honor parents is for life.
prayer: I thank You Lord, for the good example my parents set for me. I pray that my life would be a good example for my family members to follow. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Honor Your father and mother. This is the first of the _

_commandments, that ends with a promise,"_ ((Eph. 6:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There is a difference between obeying and honoring. To

obey, means to do what one is told; to honor means to

respect and love. Children are to obey while under their

parent's care, but the responsibility to honor parents is

for life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the good example my parents set for me.

I pray that my life would be a good example for my family

members to follow. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The promise for honoring your father and mother. you will live a long life, full of blessings." (Eph. 6:3)
reflection: Obeying our parents is our main task when we are young, but honoring should continue even beyond their death. One way to honor our parents is to provide for them in times of financial need or when they are unable to care for themselves. One of the best ways to honor them is to pass on their godly values to our children. (Question) Are you truly living in a way that brings honor to your parents?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me by the power of Your Holy Spirit to honor my parents as Christ honored You by fulfilling Your will while He walked this earth, even to the point of suffering for the sins of the world. Help me to mirror the godly values of my parents to my children. . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The promise for honoring your father and mother. you will live a
long _

_life, full of blessings." _(Eph. 6:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Obeying our parents is our main task when we are young, but honoring

should continue even beyond their death. One way to honor our parents

is to provide for them in times of financial need or when they are
unable

to care for themselves.One of the best ways to honor them is to pass
on

their godly values to our children. (Question) Are you truly living
in a

way that brings honor to your parents?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me by the power of Your Holy Spirit to
honor

my parents as Christ honored You by fulfilling Your will while He
walked

this earth, even to the point of suffering for the sins of the world.
Help me

to mirror the godly values of my parents to my children.. . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And now a word to you fathers. Don't make your children angry by the way you treat them. (Eph. 6:4a)
reflection: Christian parents and Christian children will relate to each other with thoughtfulness and love. This will happen if both parents and children put the others' interests ahead of their own.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the many gifts and blessing You have given us especially our children. Keep them safe and healthy I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"And now a word to you fathers. Don't make your children_

Christian parents and Christian children will relate to each other

with thoughtfulness and love. This will happen if both parents

and children put the others' interests ahead of their own.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the many gifts and

blessing You have given us especially our children.

Keep them safe and healthy I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Be strong with the Lord's mighty power." (Eph. 6:10)
reflection: In the Christian life we battle against rulers and authorities (the powerful evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a vicious fighter, see I Peter 5:8). To withstand their attacks we must depend on God's strength.
prayer: Dear Lord, it is so easy to get caught up in the activities of this world and forget to look to You each morning for Your guidance. I need Your Spirit's power to keep from falling into Satan's traps. . . Amen
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Be strong with the Lord's mighty power." _(Eph. 6:10)

In the Christian life we battle against rulers and authorities (the
powerful

evil forces of fallen angels headed by Satan, who is a vicious
fighter, see

I Pet. 5:8). To withstand their attacks we must depend on God's
strength.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, it is so easy to get caught up in the activities of this
world and

forget to look to You each morning for Your guidance. I need Your
Spirit's

power to keep from falling into Satan's traps. . . Amen

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Stand your ground, putting on the sturdy belt of truth and the body armor of God's righteousness." (Eph. 6:14)
reflection: Our nation desperately needs a revival of righteousness and justice for the oppressed. The righteousness that God values is more then refraining from sin. We need to fight in the strength of the church, where power comes from the Holy Spirit.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that a good old fashioned revival would happen in our nation. It is so easy for us, myself include to point our figure at others, but we all have enough sins in our lives to deserve Your wrath. May I allow a revival to begin in my heart. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Stand your ground, putting on the sturdy belt of truth _

_and the body armor of God's righteousness." _ (Eph. 6:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our nation desperately needs a revival of righteousness and

justice for the oppressed. The righteousness that God values

is more then refraining from sin. We need to fight in the strength

of the church, where power comes from the Holy Spirit.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that a good old fashioned revival

would happen in our nation. It is so easy for us, myself include

to point our figure at others, but we all have enough sins in our

lives to deserve Your wrath. May I allow a revival to begin in

my heart. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News, so that you will be fully prepared." (Eph. 6:15)
reflection: God says that the feet those who bring good news, are"beautiful." It is a wonderful privilege to be able to share God's Good News with others, His news of redemption, salvation, and peace. To whom do you need to share the Good News.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the privilege I have had to share The"Good News." I pray that You would forgive me for not ALWAYS fulfilling that privilege as I should. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News,_

salvation, and peace. To whom do you need to share the

Good News.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satin." (Eph. 6:16)
reflection: Jesus never promised that obeying Him would be easy. But the hard work and self-discipline of serving Christ is no burden to those who love Him. And if our load starts to feel heavy, we can always trust Christ to help us bear it. (see Matthew 11:28-30)
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for always being available to come to our aid when confronted by Satan's attacks. Forgive me for stumbling down the road of life and not always seeking Your help. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"In every battle you will need faith as your shield to stop_

_the fiery arrows aimed at you by Satin." _(Eph. 6:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus never promised that obeying Him would be easy.

But the hard work and self-discipline of serving Christ

is no burden to those who love Him. And if our load starts

to feel heavy, we can always trust Christ to help us bear it.

(see Mt. 11:28-30)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for always being available to

come to our aid when confronted by Satan's attacks.

Forgive me for stumbling down the road of life and

not always seeking Your help. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Pray at all time and on every occasion, in the power of the Holy Spirit. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all Christians everywhere." (Eph. 6:18)
reflection: I've had students ask me how you can pray at all times? One way is to0 make quick, brief prayers your habit to every situation. Another ways is to order your life around God's desire and teaching, so that your life so that your very life becomes a prayer. You can make prayer your life, and your life a prayer.
prayer: I pray for Your forgiveness for my negligence in not living a life of prayer as I should. But today I want to remember Christian Churches around the world. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Pray at all time and on every occasion, in the power of the _

_Holy Spirit.Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for _

_all Christians everywhere." _(Eph. 6:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

I've had students ask me how you can pray at all times?

One way is to0 make quick, brief prayers your habit to

every situation. Another ways is to order your life around

God's desire and teaching, so that your life so that your very

life becomes a prayer. You can make prayer your life, and

your life a prayer.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I pray for Your forgiveness for my negligence in not living a

life of prayer as I should. But today I want to remember

Christian Churches around the world. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "May God give you peace, dear brothers and sisters, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ." (Eph. 6:23)
reflection: We are encouraged to continue living responsibly in spite of critical circumstances. Christ's return is more then doctrine, IT IS A PROMISE! It is not just for the future, it has a vital impact on how we live now!
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to persevere in confident expectation that I am not alone or forgotten. Help me never forget Your promise that You would never abandon me. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_" May God give you peace, dear brothers and sisters, and love with
faith,_

_from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ." _(Eph. 6:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are encouraged to continue living responsibly in spite of critical

circumstances. Christ's return is more then doctrine, IT IS A
PROMISE!

It is not just for the future, it has a vital impact on how we live
now!

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me to persevere in confident expectation

that I am not alone or forgotten. Help me never forget Your

promise that You would never abandon me. . . Amen..

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I always pray for you, and I make my requests with a heart full of joy" (Philippians 1:4)
reflection: Paul was sharing his feelings toward all believers in Philippi. (Here are some personal thoughts to ask yourself) When others think about you, what comes to their minds? Are you remembered with joy by them? Do your acts of kindness lift up others?
prayer: Dear Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that my acts of kindness would always be remembered with joy by others. I pray that my acts of kindness would lift others up. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I always pray for you, and I make my requests with a heart full of
joy," _

(Phil. 1:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul was sharing his feelings toward all believers in Philippi.

(Here are some personal thoughts to ask yourself)

When others think about you, what comes to their minds?

Are you remembered with joy by them? Do your acts of

kindness lift up others?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that my acts of kindness

would always be remembered with joy by others. I pray that my

acts of kindness would lift others up. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "You have been my partners in spreading the Good News about Christ from the time you first believe until now." (Philippians 1:5)
reflection: Paul was thankful for the Philippians's contribution in the spreading of God's message through their financial support. As we help our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists through prayer, hospitality, and financial gifts, we become partners with them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be faithful in spreading God's message of eternal life. Help me remember to pray for our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"You have been my partners in spreading the Good News about _

_Christ from the time you first believe until now." _(Phil. 1:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul was thankful for the Philippian's contribution in the spreading

of God's message through their financial support. As we help our

ministers, missionaries, and evangelists through prayer, hospitality,

and financial gifts, we become partners with them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be faithful in

spreading God's message of eternal life. Help me remember to

pray for our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I am sure that God, who began a good work within you, will continue His work until it is finally finished on that day when Jesus comes back again." (Philippians 1:6)
reflection: Do you sometimes feel as I do, that you aren't making any progress in your spiritual life? Scriptures tell us that when God starts a project, He completes it! As with the Philippians, Scriptures also tells us God will help us grow in grace until He has completed His work in our life. When we become discouraged, let us pray for patience and remember that God HAS promised He will complete the work He has begun in us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I become discouraged with my spiritual growth I know You have promised to finish the work You have begun. Forgive me for my lack of patience. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I am sure that God, who began a good work within you, will continue
_

_His work until it is finally finished on that day when Jesus comes
back _

_again." _(Phil. 1:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Do you sometimes feel as I do, that you aren't making any progress in

your spiritual life?_ _ Scriptures tell us that when God starts a
project, He

completes it! As with the Philippians, Scriptures also tells us God
will

help us grow in grace until He has completed His work in our life.
When

we become discouraged, let us pray for patience and remember that God

HAS promised He will complete the work He has begun in us.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I become discouraged with my

spiritual growth I know You have promised to finish the work You have

begun. Forgive me for my lack of patience. . .Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I pray that your love for each other will overflow more and more, and that you will keep growing in your knowledge and understanding." (Philippians 1:9)
reflection: Often the best way to influence someone is to pray for them. Paul's prayer for the Philippians was that they would be unified in love. Their love was to result in a greater knowledge of Christ and s deeper moral discernment. As we grow in Christ's love, our heart and mind must grow together.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that it is easy to fall into the trap of praying only for family needs. I pray that you would enlighten me in the needs of others especially the less fortunate. I pray now for our ministers, missionaries, and evangelists. I pray that our country's leaders would grow in a deeper moral discernment. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I pray that your love for each other will overflow more _

_and more, and that you will keep growing in your knowledge_

_ and __understanding." _(Phil. 1:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Often the best way to influence someone is to pray for them.

Paul's prayer for the Philippians was that they would be unified

in love. Their love was to result in a greater knowledge of Christ

and s deeper moral discernment.. As we grow in Christ's love, our

heart and mind must grow together.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that it is easy to

fall into the trap of praying only for family needs. I pray

that you would enlighten me in the needs of others

especially the less fortunate. I pray now for our ministers,

missionaries, and evangelists. I pray that our country's

leaders would grow in a deeper moral discernment. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until Christ returns:" (Philippians 1:10)
reflection: Paul prayed that the Philippians believers would have the ability to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vial and trivial. We ought to pray for discernment so we can maintain our Christian morals and values. (Hebrews 5:14) We should live each day as though Christ might return at any moment.
prayer: O Lord of all creation, create now in me a discernment to always be able to maintain true Christian morals and values. Help me live each day as if Christ were to return any moment. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may_

_live pure and blameless lives until Christ returns:" _(Phil. 1:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul prayed that the Philippian believers would have the ability

to differentiate between right and wrong, good and bad, vial

and trivial. We ought to pray for discernment so we can maintain

our Christian morals and values. (Heb. 5:14) We should live each

day as though Christ might return at any moment.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of all creation, create now in me a discernment to always

be able to maintain true Christian morals and values. Help me

live each day as if Christ were to return any moment. . . Amen.
